intro: Argentina wenchuensis, commonly known as the Argentine wenchuensis, is a flowering plant native to the grasslands of Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, with narrow, grass-like leaves and yellow-orange flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the semi-arid climate of its native region. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
